actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-564, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5158. The resolution waives certain points of order during consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of section 302(f) of the Congressional Budget Act, as amended, clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI and cluase 7 of rule XXI. During consideration of the bill, all points of order against certain provisions specified in the text of the resolution shall be waived. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 125.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 351 - 59 (Roll no. 205).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5158) making appropriations for the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent agencies, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 5158 (appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 5158) making appropriations for the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and for sundry independent agencies, commissions, corporations, and offices for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.
